title: Electronic Medicine and Virtual Reality - Brain Stimulation Technologies
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Exploration of brain and nerve stimulation technologies (tDCS, TMS, TENS, EEG) and their combination with virtual reality for medical rehabilitation and cognitive enhancement

transcranial_direct_stimulation.mechanism: Currents sent to head through skull to change brainwaves

transcutaneous_electrical_nerve_stimulat.mechanism: Currents sent through skin to stimulate nerves

electroencephalography.use: Perfect the art of stimulating specific brain parts
electroencephalography.method: Use tDCS/TMS/TENS, then EEG to pinpoint what's happening, then repeat in others

process: Create VR program showing arms/legs moving
Stimulate brain parts connected to those limbs
limb_rehabilitation.equipment: Device that looks like Mickey Mouse hat

cognitive_enhancement_example.setup: Woman with device on head and arm
cognitive_enhancement_example.result_with: Much more accurate, time passed differently for her

learning_enhancement.prediction: Will be able to make learning feel like doing cocaine

technology_summary.tDCS: Electrical current through skull → brainwave changes
technology_summary.TENS: Electrical current through skin → nerve stimulation
technology_summary.EEG: Brain activity measurement → mapping and replication

quiz_questions.q: What is the difference between tDCS and TMS?
quiz_questions.a: tDCS uses electrical currents through skull; TMS uses magnetic fields - both change brainwaves
quiz_questions.explanation: Different mechanisms for similar brain stimulation effects

quiz_questions.q: How do hospitals use tDCS with VR for rehabilitation?
quiz_questions.a: Show VR of limbs moving while stimulating connected brain parts - patient eventually regains mobility
quiz_questions.explanation: Combines visual feedback with direct brain stimulation

quiz_questions.a: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation - sends currents through skin to stimulate nerves
quiz_questions.explanation: Different from tDCS which goes through skull to brain

quiz_questions.q: What role does EEG play in this technology?
quiz_questions.a: Measures brain activity to pinpoint effects of stimulation, allowing replication in other people
quiz_questions.explanation: Perfects the art of targeted brain stimulation
